p: Hepatitis may also be caused by other types of micro-organisms including bacteria, fungi and even parasites, non-infectious agents like drugs and alcohol, and other metabolic and autoimmune diseases [ 34]. Hepatitis infections may either be acute (short-term), where the body will be able to resolve the infection or chronic (long-term), where the body is unable to resolve the infection, resulting in liver failure, liver cirrhosis and liver cancer.
